Sorry Ken, what I meant by that was upload the data
that we want to store for neat.  I like the idea of
being able to upload publicly.

Rog




--- kstanley@... wrote:
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Roger Smith
> <rog_21@y...> wrote:
> > Hi All,
> > I am going to being setting up our repository. I
> have
> > taken note of some of the recommendations. So I
> will
> > go ahead and set something up and we can make
> changes
> > from there. One question I did have though was,
> how do
> > we want to upload documentation to this site?
> > Do we want anyone/everyone to be able to upload (
> so
> > we do it via a web interface) Or do we want to log
> > into unix machine and ftp it?  What do you
> recommend?
> > Thanks
> > Rog
> > 
> 
> Hi Rog, I'm not sure what you mean by "upload
> documentation to the
> site?"  What kind of documentation do you mean?
> 
> But to answer your other question, I think it would
> be nice to have a
> web interface for uploads.  If someone uploads
> something
> innapropriate, we don't have to include it.  What do
> others think
> about this?
> 
> ken
> 
>
